column4: can anyone else tell me, how can i put a script in system startup?
not as easy at editing autoexec.bat, mind you
basically you need to create a script in /etc/init.d/, which can take a "start", "stop" or "restart" argument, and then use update.rc-d to register that script
no, it doesn't seem very right. does "apt-cache policy x-window-system-dev" show anything under "Installed:" ?
I am trying to solve this for the last two hours :(
what program are you trying to compile?
its one of my economics related software
now! do you have any idea whats going wrong?
no. the configure is complaining about missing X headers, but if you have x-window-system-dev installed (which you do), you have the headers
then how can I tell configure script about that?
it really depends on the program...
